meanings.sent1: She walked sulkily away from the group, upset about not getting her favorite snack.
meanings.sent2: He sat sulkily in the corner after being scolded for not finishing his homework.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked sulkily at its empty food bowl, hoping someone would fill it soon.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hung sulkily in the sky, threatening rain at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The old man sulkily refused to join the dance, preferring to watch from the sidelines.

meanings.definition: Showing resentment or irritation by sulking
meanings.sent1: The sulkily child refused to speak to anyone after not getting the toy she wanted.
meanings.sent2: His sulkily expression made it clear he was not happy with the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent3: The dog gave a sulkily bark when told it was time to go inside, clearly not ready to leave the park.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered sulkily in the distance, hinting at a coming downpour.
meanings.sent5: Her sulkily attitude towards her chores made her mother worry about her mood.
